website_summaries.verdict: It has a lot of appealing qualities, but other products on our list may give you more for your money.
pros: 200 mph blowing power offers exceptional residential performance
Similar features to models that cost hundreds of dollars more
cons: 48 cc engine may not be practical for industrial-strength jobs, but it still has a lot of might for the size

customer_reviews.title: poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Cannot run at full power. Amazon was great but Poulan Pro customer service was beyond awful. Cuts out once throttle is fully depressed. Poulan Pro first wanted me to take it to a service center. Service center wanted nothing to do with it and told me to seek a replacement directly from Poulan Pro. Subsequent phone calls to Poulan Pro were a waste of time. They refused to take responsibility or offer any solution. Given the lack of customer service from Poulan Pro, avoid and look elsewhere. In addition the serial number on box was missing from product itself. Serial provided on box did not match Poulan Pro database.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: ( not good on a new product
customer_reviews.text: It ran one time and then it started to fail. If the choke isn't half on the engine will sputter and die when using the throttle. Apparently I cannot return it as I am just over the 30 day mark. Unfortunate. Will not likely buy another Poulan Product. I called the customer server and was referred to a service center but there would be a charge :( not good on a new product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues at the factory...cheap spark plug wire and boot...
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturing defect. Quit after a couple of hours. Been waiting for three months for the promised new unit...of course after leaf season. Been a headache for the local service company here in Lynchburg, but they have been really good about follow up and contact. Worked well for a while...oh, when I went to check the spark plug to see why it stopped and wouldn’t restart, the wire ripped out of the boot and the spring clip attached to the spark plug needed a pair of pliers to be removed. Really?
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Aiello

customer_reviews.title: Way better than hand held blowers
customer_reviews.text: I have had both electric and gas powered hand leaf blowers, but none compare to this one. It does the job many times better than the hand ones. Takes a little getting used to (starting it then putting it on your back), and it might feel a bit heavy after an hour or so of use, but still is the answer to all my needs. Leaves, sand on driveway, etc. Good product. Caution: I tried to run it with my pre-mixed fuel/oil solution I had at home. Would not get up to full speed. After mixing a new container with the (included) synthetic two-stroke oil, ran like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: It does not start easily since we purchased 6 weeks ago.
customer_reviews.text: If it works, it is great but starting this devil is elbow hurting. Direct service support does not exist but redirecting to private service centers that may not return phone call for days. I have been calling all the local listed service center on their website all of them refused to honor any kind of warranty. They said that this is a cheap poor quality blower. Amazon must help us resolving this problem or take it back and show it to this company.
customer_reviews.author: Vinit K.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this blower for my Landscaping business excellent price and product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this blower for my Landscaping business excellent price and product. I have no problems what so ever. Makes my job easier :)
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: this is the absolute worst blower. Ran it 4-5 times last season and ...
customer_reviews.text: this is the absolute worst blower. Ran it 4-5 times last season and tried starting it up and it doesn't work anymore. Cleaned the carb, drained the gas and put fresh in, cleaned the exhaust shield. It runs on choke but once let off choke it bogs out and dies right down. After reading reviews on this piece of crap 9 months after i buy it, i see that this is happening to others to. Note to self..don't ever spend $200 on a backpack blower. I'll never buy a poulan product again
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and easy to use great for Newbies and Pros
customer_reviews.text: First I’m gonna start by saying I was once a landscaper soooo... I know a little somethin,Perfect size blower work like a Champ. And for the price you get a whole lot more than what you pay for. My wife got for me I love it, opps I mean HER. “LoL” hope u 1,enjoy my friends
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Juelz

customer_reviews.title: I like the unit
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit. It runs & works well. However, when I went to fill out the $10 rebate form I found that in order to qualify for the rebate, you must also purchase (2) cans of premix fuel (and at the same time you buy the blower). Nowhere in the ad does it state this. You must read the rebate form to see this information. It's pretty deceptive. I would have given 5 stars if the information was more forthcoming.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Schwaikert

customer_reviews.title: USE 40:1 FUEL!!!
customer_reviews.text: Re the pr48: PLEASE READ The manual says to use 50:1 fuel mix. Their website says it uses 40:1. Their is a button on website that says “ask a expert”. I used his feature and they responded in 2 minutes saying the manual is wrong-use 40:1..so glad I double checked.
customer_reviews.author: tbs

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This product would not start when it was delivered. I brought it to a certified dealer to identify the issue. The blower needed a part. The part is on back-order with Poulon Pro for 6 weeks! I’m still waiting for the part! The product has never worked since I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Rusert

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, great blower
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have ever made on Amazon! I have used a 25cc Homelite backpack blower for years. I was blown away (no pun intended) by the difference in performance of the Poulan Pro; I can clear my driveway and yard of pine straw, leaves (including wet leaves) and pine cones in one-fourth the time that the Homelite took, and get a better job. It starts easily, is relatively quiet and low vibration. The "cruise control" switch on the handle is great as you don't have to keep the throttle trigger depressed when blowing large areas.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd M. McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Ran great on the first day
customer_reviews.text: Ran great on the first day. It would NOT start a week later. I tried and tried - and yes I totally know all of the mechanics of starting, choking etc. I finally realized, it's just not worth it. I spent $300 more and bought a Stihl. Yes, money matters, but this thing would not start after a week.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 5-month a light use
customer_reviews.text: I used the blower once every 1-2 weeks and was satisfied until 5-months from the day I received it... During use it started to loose power until it died. I have not be able to restart it since. I checked the air filter and it is totally clean and everything looks completely new. Amazon return and support window is closed, so I am screwed. I can't recommend this product as my expectation is that it would at least last 2-years at this relative light use level. Dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Things to know about starting it though a great leaf blower....
customer_reviews.text: This is not as light as some but light enough. It's powerful for those oak leaves and wet pollen makers. You MUST read all instructions. ***The primer ball is hard to find look hard. The start button is on the grip. It doesn't matter if you turn on button or prime first as long as both are done*** It will not be hard to start of you do this my husband says. I as a 5'4 older woman with back and neck issues I can not use this so I use a cordless for deck and garden.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Great blower for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this backpack blower after my Craftsman hand held bit the dust last year. I have used it quite a bit this summer, and have not had any of the loss of power issues that some complain about. I have made sure to use 100% gasoline in the mix, rather than the standard Ethanol gas, and maybe that makes a difference? It's not the lightest backpack blower, but not terribly heavy, either. If it lasts me a couple of years, I'll consider it worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stradley

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed and that price! Found a review on top five backpack blowers on line. This machine was rated most economical. Very easy set up had it up and running in about 10 minutes. Over $100 cheaper then the nearest competitor made this an easy purchase. Only negative is holding it still to pull start is a little tough but overall I give this machine 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kulaponeke

customer_reviews.title: “Blown” away
customer_reviews.text: If you want something that is affordable and can keep up with the rival dads around you, this is your ticket to masculine affirmation. Whether it’s clearing 0.72 acres of leaves, dusting off grass clippings, or blowing away rotted crab-apple guts, this blower has done an amazing job. It’s been easy to start, after you remember to turn the power switch to the ON position, it’s not terribly heavy, and the seems to be well built. Make sure you use the premixed 50/50 fuel instead of gas station ethanol-infused juice of lies. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy another one...for my other house, with my other family, if I was a polygamist.
customer_reviews.author: titochachang

customer_reviews.title: Be Warned!! - Light Weight Tasks ONLY!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I am a Poulan fan, however, this was simply disappointing. It is lightweight and so is it blowing power. My handheld Poulan from 8 years ago is stronger than this. If you only need to blow clipping off a sidewalk... or blow leaves downhill with a strong wind at your back then this is it; anything else its disappointing. Returning and buying a "real" backpack blower
customer_reviews.author: Fursty

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: At first I was impressed by but as I used it more the quality dimisied (within 10 uses). It is not as powerful and does not run at full throttle.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: BEATS RAKING ORDER IT
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for the money. First time homeowner here building up my tools and this was my choice for leaf blower due to price point. Satisfied for the money but I do wish it had more “balls”. I hope this review is helpful. Update- thing won’t start. Buy a huskarvanah.
customer_reviews.author: KJGreen220

customer_reviews.title: Strong blower!
customer_reviews.text: It's very strong and easy to start. Gave as a present to my son for Christmas and he loves it. It's lighter than others we've used in the past. We've used it against 4 inches of leaves that has been dead - decomposed and wet without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: S3adrag0n

customer_reviews.title: This is Fair quality product
customer_reviews.text: I was the owner of a BP 30 Portland blower and had it for over 20 years with that in mind I elected to purchase a new one this one came with the features that My old one had The engine was slightly larger than I expected very performance I find myself slightly disappointed the performance is actually worse than my old one it’s fair performance for the price But I had expected better since I am a prior owner and the backpack I had was absolutely excellent
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Mazzella

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase these refurbished items.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying Poulan quality, instead I have battled this thing for a year and a half and two shops. No one can find out why it runs good to 5 minutes then quits and will not crank. Live and learn, Hopefully people here can learn from my mistakes. When ever they called themselves refurbishing this thing was during it's 5 good minutes, I wish they had tried to use it twice or for longer... Refurbished garbage.
customer_reviews.author: LouisP

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Worked maybe 10 times before the engine just ...
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Worked maybe 10 times before the engine just gave up. It starts, but when you hit the throttle it stops the engine. You can play with the choke to keep it running, but ultimately it quits every time. Waste of money. Reading the reviews many people have the same issue. Purchase an echo.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: hard to start
customer_reviews.text: I used this blower for 35 hours and it does a great job on the leaves . It idols well and not too heavy . It is hard to start but I expected that. I would buy this again and recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: BILLY

customer_reviews.title: One use.  Now worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I was able to start this machine just once. It worked well for several hours. Fast forward a week. It won't start. Tried all troubleshooting suggestions from the manufacturer. Nada. This is a poor quality purchase. PLEASE avoid this product and manufacturer. UPDATE: Waited a few weeks. Fresh gas. Fresh attitude. Still a non-starter. Poulan should be preparing for the class action suit on this one.
customer_reviews.author: BrianW

customer_reviews.title: i'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: starts every time. plenty of power for the home owner. i have an electric blower to go with my tool kit for the garage/patio which works great but not enough for my 2 acres. so far only hiccup is when running wide open every 10 seconds or so it will bog down a RPMS and then return to screaming. i've only put 1 tank of fuel through it so i'm hoping it just needs to break in a little more. other than that its great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow you are a walking hurricane!
customer_reviews.text: I keep finding more and more uses for this beast of a machine! It is awesome for cleaning your garage floor from salt and dust. Also cleaning off deck is now a breeze. Just enough power to handle a giant pile of leaves. I have a large yard and when I first started cleaning up I went through almost an entire tank of gas. (2 stroke). Once you just have to maintain things everything gets much easier. It was a little chore assembling but you only need to do that once. Love this powerhouse.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not A Bad Blower
customer_reviews.text: I like this leaf blower a lot because it blows at a good speed and helps with my yard work but a few things that are keeping me from giving it a 5 star rating is that the straps don't stay on very well and the clamps that hold the straps in keeps coming undone and basically I think I need a new strap on just maybe one year of using it lightly and it is a little tough at getting the tube part of the blower attached which is kind of frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Burns

customer_reviews.title: Great blower
customer_reviews.text: Put together and bought the pre mix 50:1 fuel at Lowe’s and runs perfect!! Lots power and even looks sporty for a blower. * I recommend using pre mix fuel and not mixing yourself. I can mix myself, but gas And mix always gives problems to Small engines. Pre mix fuel cost more, but I never have Problems with my chain saws or trimmers. Great deal on the blower even delivered!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Assembly a little bit hard, the instructions so hard to understand but we survived. I didn’t use gasoline I just bought mixed fuel 50:1 minutes excellent. Started the Blower was a little bit difficult again cause the instructions were so confused but finally we did it. I love it is so powerful, I used it after two days raining and worked perfect , so comfortable, so light. I used it to clean my property it has a mixed of texture some parts has rocks and others... but anyway I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Almonte

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed shoulder straps
customer_reviews.text: I like this blower because it is fairly light, but has a lot of power. No problem moving leaves etc. around. A little quirky to start. Instead of a bulb type to get gas into the system, it uses a clear plastic line. Very poorly designed shoulder straps. They just plain hurt when the blower is on my back. I am going to try and put on some new straps from a back pack or something. Very good power, but the poor shoulder straps make me almost not want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Paradee

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This item is absolutely amazing! A fantastic item at a great value. People complaining about this item obviously are not mixing their fuel correctly and causing damage to the item. Make sure you understand mixing your fuel properly or buying pre mixed fuel. I have had no problems whatsoever with this item! It is absolutely fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick F.

customer_reviews.title: A powerful unit.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of back pack leaf blowers a good while. This one is comfortable to wear but is heavy. Much heavier than the one that died on me and had to be replaced. Also the blowing tube isn't very flexible. Overall, this unit isn't as easy to use as some, but it works well and starts easy. Which is good because it's going to get a lot of use for my yard is large with patios and sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: Texas David 7

customer_reviews.title: Works great! It is powerful
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for about a month. Works great! It is powerful. Starts right up. Feel little or no vibration. Comfortable to wear. It does weigh about 20 lbs. I wouldn't want to wear it very long, which I only need to wear it for about 30 mins at most. I do wear ear protection just as I do with all my noisy equipment. So far I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: rayzinside

customer_reviews.title: MUST WEAR EAR PROTECTION!
customer_reviews.text: it's a good blower, a little more powerful than my old one, but truly my ears are ringing so badly I feel like I attended a rock concert in the front row. DANGEROUS. I'm heading back in to purchase ear protection. Wish I'd known. It might be in the reviews....it is now.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela B.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Blower worked well the first time out of the box. Then it would not run full throttle or with choke fully open. DO NOT BUY! You definitely get what you pay for. Amazon's return policy is great. We returned and purchased an Echo backpack blower. Read all the bad reviews before buying. Poulan may want to remove this product!
customer_reviews.author: Eddiecamp

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this
customer_reviews.text: My son's home has a large yard surrounded by trees. Raking is a chore. I got him this leaf blower and he loves it, saying it cut his work time to 1/4th. He also likes shooting air at my grandson. Only complaint was how the product information described the required fuel. My son said he went to three stores and couldn't find the described fuel. I went in and got the same fuel I use for my chainsaw and it worked fine. Son is an engineer and still is put out by the poor documentation.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: 2 year warranty BLOWS more than Back pack blower, model PR48BT.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on 06/13/2019 for leaf clean up. I noticed that sometimes it was running rough to the point that it would stall. Blower would run a little better if you used throttle lock position. I ordered a new spark plug hoping that this would solve the problem without taking the blower in for service. The new spark plug made no difference. I dropped blower off for service on 07/23/20, just picked up today 08/28/20. I was told by authorized repair center that Poulan has decided NOT to go ahead with repair, because repair exceeds 70% of machines value. This blower has only been used approx.10 times in just over one year. POULAN 2 WARRANTY BLOWS HARDER THAN BACK PACK BLOWER
customer_reviews.author: Carol Korte

customer_reviews.title: Favorite tool in my garage!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but great things ti say about this leaf blower. For the price I honestly wasn't ever expecting to get what it delivers. I have a 1/2 acre of yard full of pine needles as well as pine cones and let me tell you this blower will blow pine cones with no issues whatsoever. It helps keep my car and driveway clean and I could not be happier. If you're in the market for a leaf blower, look no further! Great deal for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ali Y.

customer_reviews.title: It last little more than three months, then it ...
customer_reviews.text: It last little more than three months, then it broke down, I called their customer service, got me an appointment for service, took one week to let me know that the problem was that the gas did not properly mix with engine oil and they can't honor its warranty, this is a piece of junk and now I lost money betting on them.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E. Lizarraga

customer_reviews.title: Backpack Gas Powered Blower
customer_reviews.text: It has a 50:1 mix ratio of Gasoline and Oil. It's a 2 cc engine. Well it was a piece of cake to assemble the blower wand. It came with enough oil to mix with 1 gallon of gasoline. I blew the leaves in my yard today and it worked like a champ. Great Price and great product. I highly recommend this ti anyone who needs to clean leaves or other debris.
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.
customer_reviews.text: The one I had ran well for about 10 hours. After that, it got weak, and sounded like it had a battery. Maybe the carb got clogged, but I was glad someone stole it off the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Chico Corrales

customer_reviews.title: No more pine needles
customer_reviews.text: I have a half acre with four large pine trees that continually dump needles all over my desert landscaping. Small electric blowers just couldn't hack it. And then, I was always tripping over the cord. With the Poulan strapped to my back, I can cruise all over and blow those pesky needles into piles for easy pick up. It's a lot of fun, too.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Van Rhyn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machinr for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading the reviews. I looked at other makes, but settled on this one after i could not beat the price and i am more then happy. Works great! Blows leaves with no problem. Even damp leaves. You get about 90 min of run time out of a tank of gas. Very easy on the body as well. Other than walking around you dont feel it at all. I cleaned up over an acre in less than 2 hours multiple times now. Even blows small sticks and acorns.
customer_reviews.author: semperfi363

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!!!  Junk
customer_reviews.text: Has the power to push a lot of leaves if you can keep it running long enough! Made in China and that's exactly what you get. Junk from China. Used aprox 8x's and even bought a 4yr extended warranty. Have brought into a service center 3 x's and NOW they tell me it's a Fuel related problem that isn't covered under any warranty. I live on a farm and all of my yard equipment has been working great with the same gas/oil mixture. This thing is GARBAGE!! I WILL NEVER USE POULAN PRO PRODUCTS AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first day, Poulan has yet to fix it more than 2 month later.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it a better rating. Work well when I received it, started easy, tons of power. But the tube holding the joystick broke within an hour of using. I took it in on 11/11/2017 and still to this date (1/24/2018) have not received it back. Store stated that the plastic part is backordered even though they are still pushing out new blowers daily. Very disappointed in the customer service on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not working. Never used.
customer_reviews.text: The motor is locked up and will not start. Do not buy this blower.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great blower for the price
customer_reviews.text: Originally tried the TORO electric as I wanted to avoid the maintenance of a gas tool but the TOT didnt last long enough and I went for the Poulan- this thing is great- really blows well and comfortable on your back. Not sure if they do a version with an electric start but would certainly suggest it if they do although I've had no issues with the pull string to date
customer_reviews.author: GadgetFreak

customer_reviews.title: would be 5 stars if it would run through the hole tank of gas
customer_reviews.text: Starts by the 3rd pull every time. blows really good. Not heavy on the back and doesn’t vibrate much unless it’s idling. starts to starve for fuel when it gets to around half a tank. I get about 30-45 min of run time before it gets to half a tank and starts to starve for fuel but if I lean to one side I can get another 10-15 min before I have to lean so far that I start to lose balance and fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Travis K.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great after fixing initial quality issue
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it a 5 star had it worked perfect as shipped. However the throttle was out of adjustment from the factory. With warm motor full trigger pull would result in low rpm and hesitation. With slight release of trigger pressure it would run fine at full throttle. Needed throttle adjustment to resolve. Other than that it works great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DRL

customer_reviews.title: It is well designed and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time and is ...
customer_reviews.text: This blower is a beast !!! I have been using blowers for years to clear leaves off of a 1/2 acre lot in the middle of the woods and have had a few and this blower exceeds all the others hands down !! If you see any reviews stating that it lacks power ignore them !! This blower has cut my work time in half and I'm not exaggerating !! It will kick the biggest piles right out of your way !! It is well designed and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time and is very easy to start !! Try it !! You'll like it !!! or like me, love it !!!
customer_reviews.author: FLG

customer_reviews.title: Does not start easily, cumbersome and ridiculously heavy for the little power it has.
customer_reviews.text: Took multiple very hard pulls to start every time during the first day of use. At one point took 7 pulls. Unbelievably heavy, which you would think would mean stronger power. Not the case. Very weak power. My back now hurts after less than an hour of use. Also it’s very cumbersome. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to start up
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my worst investments. It's dam near impossible to get it started. If you ever get it to run, it's awesome but you'll pull a muscle first fot sure.
customer_reviews.author: Bincy Stephen

customer_reviews.title: My review
customer_reviews.text: You have to get closer to the leaves than you would like to blow away some leaves. The power is weaker than our previous leaf blower.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Check the area you live in.
customer_reviews.text: We have had to take it in to be worked on twice, have to wait for them to get the parts which takes a long time to get. Wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Teague

customer_reviews.title: Not Starting After 3 Uses
customer_reviews.text: I have 30 trees on my property, and now that fall is in full swing I wanted to use my blower. I tried to get it started for 30+ minutes and it would not start. This is the 4th time I used the blower.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Gave this leaf blower as a present for my husband. He has been very pleased with it. It does almost everything he wants it to do. His only complaint was that he can't start it while he has it on. But many leaves have left our yard. Haven't had a chance to use for anything else yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Backpack model is essential if you have a lot to do
customer_reviews.text: We live in the country and are surrounded by woods. We also have a long steep driveway--getting the leaves off the driveway before winter is dire for us in terms of avoiding ice. Getting this backpack model was a HUGE improvement over the handheld model we were using before. It would help a lot if this model had a waist belt as long use (three-four hours at a time) resulted in a sore shoulder on the wand side. Other than that, it works great--powerful, easy to start, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J.

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic price for a great machine!!
customer_reviews.text: I Love this blower. Fantastic blower. Ive had echo. Stihl, AND this is the best one I've had. VERY powerful and lite weight. Highly recommend to anyone, commercial use and or home use. Perfect for any job, very reliable. More reliable than ur spouse. I give it a 10 !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Glen G.

customer_reviews.title: So happy I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Read all the the reviews and decided to go ahead with the purchase , I’m so glad I did. I am a short, middle age woman and I had no problem putting it together or using it. If you are a lefty, as I am, it’s a little difficult to start. As most products, it’s designed for righty’s. Great product, would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: flintcrazy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home owner with a big yard
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is a great price on a strong blower. Poulan is part of Husqvarna co, so the quality is right up there with it’s big brother. I have used echo & Husqvarna Blowers as a professional landscaper back in the day, and this one is great.. don’t forget ear protection!!
customer_reviews.author: Rory Stark

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought one years ago.Did the driveway in less than half the time of my handheld.
customer_reviews.author: faw43

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal on a strong performing unit
customer_reviews.text: This product worked as it should took a little to assemble but very easy to do. Once assembled it worked flawlessly. I ran two tanks of fuel through it with no issues at all. I would definitely recommend for the homeowner with a large amount of trees. I have 3 acres and the leaves killed my handheld gas blower. This blower didn't even have to work hard to handle the leaves. Strongly recommend for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Added a little fuel mix and had it fired up ...
customer_reviews.text: Added a little fuel mix and had it fired up and working in seconds I have a large piece of property and this is going to save me time and fatigue for sure, I ran it for over an hour first time out and could have used it an hour more without discomfort
customer_reviews.author: Martin Borho

customer_reviews.title: Solid Blower
customer_reviews.text: Good blower. I use the premixed gas and oil and it has had no issue starting. At times I wish it was a little more powerful but it gets the job done for a residential home. I have a huge yard. Honestly I’ve never had a high powered blower so I don’t know what to compare it to, but works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ken and Nell

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I’m impressed. Easy to start. Strong enough to move all types of leaves and debris. After reading some negative reviews and then seeing no Poulan models were reviewed by Consumer Reports I got cold feet and I tried to cancel my order - but was too late! I’m glad though because this blower is made well and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O'

customer_reviews.title: acres. Backpack blower great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a good leaf blower this is a good one and at a good price I used it for about fifteen minutes and then my wife wanted to try it out she went over the entire yard so I jumped on the mower and cleaned up good it's over two and a half acers.
customer_reviews.author: mike cox

customer_reviews.title: Want my money back
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. Both gas leaks out of it. I want to return for a full refund not a replacement. Since it’s a replacement I have no way to return. I need someone at Amazon to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Davis

customer_reviews.title: Poulan Pro PR48BT
customer_reviews.text: Always difficult to start, after its warm and with choke fully opened, bogs down on acceleration, close the choke a tad bit and full blowing force is then achieved... Works well though... Wear ear protection, or you'll hear ringing in your ears all day!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brod Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Starting issues very soon after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Twice they broke down in a very short period of time. On the first one the pull string gave out and the second one wouldn't start anymore after only a few month. I went by the numbers of reviews and excellent rating, but unfortunately I didn't have the same great experience as others had. Now onto a different brand which hopefully will last longer. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. It is junk!
customer_reviews.text: It started 1 time and ran for 5 minutes. Piston has hole in it. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: mydas

customer_reviews.title: Powerful leaf blower.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the blower for about 5 hours and have been completely impressed. I have a large property with lots of oak leaves and this is just the ticket. It starts quite easily and can move a tremendous amount of debris. So far I'm completely impressed.
customer_reviews.author: kingfisher

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blower for the price. I've already used it several times with no issues. For those having problems with it not operating properly at full power - This is because the engine is not getting enough fuel. To fix this just leave the choke on slightly. I haven't checked to see if the carb is adjustable as adjusting it for more fuel would permanently fix the problem as well.
customer_reviews.author: thadd677

customer_reviews.title: Powerful.  Clunky.
customer_reviews.text: Poulan added tubes to a big engine and called it a blower. Seriously, it's that awkward and heavy. Too brutish for small jobs, too uncomfortable for large jobs. A disappointing product from Poulan.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2018,have used it for 2 seasons.Easily clears our acre and half property of leaves and debris.Runs excellent on premixed fuel in canister.Easy to start every time.It is slightly heavy and noticeable after wearing extended periods of time though
customer_reviews.author: Tundraguy 43

customer_reviews.title: When it runs it is great
customer_reviews.text: It was Blowing wet leaves like they were dry. Filled it with fuel and it wouldn’t start no matter how many times I pulled. I let it sit for a half hour and still had a hard time getting it to run but it did
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GAME CHANGER💪🏿😎
customer_reviews.text: Game changer. I like my leaf blower a lot. Raking my yard and customers yard is at a bare minimum now. It blows debris real hard. IMO its a champ just like the Poulan Pro Chainsaw. The price was easy on the wallet. The other brands were $300-$500 at the store where i live. All in all i am happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: CoprToneNTVE

customer_reviews.title: Utter Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK for a couple of months and then started crapin out. Thought it was the carburetor, cleaned that out, cleaned plugs. This thing is junk! It’s stored indoors but will still literally take 60/70 pulls to get it to start. And then will sputter, choke out and make your task near impossible. I can’t sell it used because that would just be rude. DO NOT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Mccabe

customer_reviews.title: lasts about one season then failure
customer_reviews.text: Worked as it should for one season then began having issues with staying fired. Thought is was a gas issue but it appears to be a spark issue. It will wait until after the warranty period to fail as most questionable machines will. I''ll do another brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bujak

customer_reviews.title: Great leaf blower. Perfect for my large yard.
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. Read the directions when putting it together. We have about 2 acres so it has been put to the rest more than once. Definitely worth it. I have a plug in one for cleaning back porch and such. This is in a whole different league.
customer_reviews.author: Kyser Soze

customer_reviews.title: Very happy overall..
customer_reviews.text: It's what I was expecting and I'm very happy overall.. The one issue I was worried about from the reviews was the engine not reving properly at full throttle.. unfortunately I do have the same problem.. BUT it seems that if I adjust the CHOKE so it is only slightly engaged it seems to work just fine...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and makes cleanup much easier
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to start the first time but I eventually got it going by opening the air cleaner and using starting spray. First few times I used it, it bogged down a lot but after 10 minutes of use ran well. It's not doing this now. It has lots of power and is a huge help with my one acre yard.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Allinder

customer_reviews.title: Its still nice to get the load off my arms though
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for more power over a regular handheld 200mph blower, but its about the same. I guess 200mph is 200mph. Its still nice to get the load off my arms though.
customer_reviews.author: Darren E.

customer_reviews.title: Great blower for great price
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. For 175 bucks one can’t go wrong. I’ve used it about 10 times since purchase. I use the 50:1 premix stuff from hardware store. It starts on second pull everytime. It’s about as loud as any other 2 cycle blower. It’s very powerful. It seems to be well made. Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: NRL1029

customer_reviews.title: For the money, best out there unless you want to spend more.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and powerful for a smaller motor. Instructions for assembly were spot on. Started the first pull and idled perfectly. I ran a full tank of fuel to blow an acre full of oak trees with no problem. If you have an 1/2 to 2 acres like me with too many trees, this is the product you need.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Loyd

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Blower
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he loves it! He said it is very powerful and it is exactly what he wanted. We even received it an entire week earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bbowl164

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this backpack blower. Engine doesn't run properly. Engine speed varies without throttle control and sometimes almost dies. Also this backpack is much heavier than the older version. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Camaro Owner

customer_reviews.title: Runs great but...
customer_reviews.text: This unit starts and runs great but it is a bit hard to pull. When you pull the recoil to start it the unit will twist if you don't have a good hold of it as it takes some unexpected effort. I am hoping that as it breaks in it will become easier.
customer_reviews.author: SCaspers

customer_reviews.title: Good Blowing power and easy start.
customer_reviews.text: Like it Love it! This is my first backpack blower. Has plenty of power to do the job compared to my electric. Don't us ethanol gas, 100% only!!! One gal of gas to 2.5oz of 2 stroke oil. If not used often, drain or run it out of fuel. I follow these steps on ALL of my small engines and has made a world of crank ability to them all of many years. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: David D Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Been very good so far. I’ve used it several times and it starts easy, really moves debris with ease even though you don’t feel a lot of force or vibration...which is a good thing. Highly impressed far. Be sure to remove the stored parts in the hose tube before putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: nashvillebassplayer

customer_reviews.title: ONLY USED THIS TWICE
customer_reviews.text: The third time i went to use this i had a hard time starting it. Come to find out the plastic piece covering the carb. cracked & broke off. I wish i new how to send the picture of this. I was hoping that Poulin would replace it.
customer_reviews.author: david m zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Good Power great value
customer_reviews.text: Have never purchased a blower before, and was concerned by some of the reviews. This blower in a relatively short period of time moved 3 to 4 inches of complete leaf coverage in my 3/4 of an acre backyard. It ran with no issues, And I think it is critical to use 50 to 1 pre-mixed fuel – I went through eight cans of it and never had a starting issue or running issue. I had probably 20 to 30 shut down and restart’s without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Schini III

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I invested in this backpack blower. I used trufuel and primed and off I went taking care of my acre yard. Just remember when putting the tubes together add a little wd40 so they side on easy.
customer_reviews.author: Stevec316

customer_reviews.title: "would buy again"
customer_reviews.text: Residential gutter cleaning and blowing yard waste into pile. Excellent, excellent and more excellent....regarding item and transaction.
customer_reviews.author: The Critic

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: Used it three times. Sat for a month. Used it again and it's at 50% power. Sloooow to get up to full RPM. I even used the expensive canned fuel from Home Depot thinking it would prevent carb issues. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle and Michele Simons

customer_reviews.title: This is a great backpack blower
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for two seasons now, and am very pleased with its operation. Starts easily, really blows well. Not as big an bulky as other blowers I have used but just as powerful. It was easy to assemble and to learn how to use... Well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rainmaninwa

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good blower, it’s definitely not a stihl but it does what it’s designed for I got this on sale for 135 dollars. Great price but if you need power go for a stihl trust me I work for stihl and nothing compares to a stihl backpack blower. But if you run 50:1 and marine gas this will last forever
customer_reviews.author: justice Alicea: Lost &Found resale furniture

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good machine. 2 tanks of gas thru it since purchasing and no issues yet. It's been put away for the winter, without gas in the tank, and we'll try it again in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Hobbs II
